title: A couple tips for anyone getting into Katarina.
body:
I have been playing Kat for a while and know her well. Here are some tips for anyone new to her!

http://www.auplod.com/u/dlouap754c5.jpeg

Tip 1: Using your E (Shunpo) for trading.

     Often times you are going to verse someone in lane with significantly strong skill shots (e.g. {{champion:157}}  tornado, {{champion:76}}  spear, {{champion:131}} crescent, etc.) It is important that you time your trades correctly so you can come out on top despite her weak laning phase. One thing I like to do as Kat is farm passively and safely until the enemy laner decides to trade. For example, If I am vs Nidalee, my main goal is to avoid her spear. If she throws one out at you, use your E to fly on top of them. This allows you to dodge her spear (Negating most of her damage) and also begin dealing some damage. Once you are on them you can finish up with a Q - W combo and use the movespeed to run away. I would be careful of using this when you are unaware of where their jungler is at it can set you up for a gank and not give you a way to escape.
     Another way you can use her E is for poking safely. You are going to be poking with your Q (Bouncing blades) constantly, and most people will back up a bit to avoid you from activating the mark. Although you can use this as a zone technique, you can also use it to your advantage trade wise. After throwing your Q at an enemy, back up a bit. Most people will see you backing up and inch forward to avoid missing farm. If you try to move up to shunpo them, they will probably back up before you can do anything. A good way to activate your mark safely is to E on to a minion near them and then use your W. It is unexpected and effective. Use your movespeed to avoid skill shots and run away.

Tip 2: Teamfighting.

     So many times I see new/inexperienced Katarina players team fight incorrectly. Timing is extremely important with kat as it is one of your only obstacles. The main problem I see with some Kat players is channeling their ult to long and missing out on a lot of free kills. As we all know, you can walk out of kats ult range and live if she used her E to engage. It is important to remember Kats ult is mainly used to get 1 kill and then finish the rest with your e - w combo. Don't keep channeling the whole fight, just enough to get them low so you can finish them off with your shunpo spin. Because there is a high chance of your ult getting canceled, it is crucial to remember this. 

Please feel free to ask questions below, I know enough about her to answer them (whether it be itemization or other game mechanics.)

Thanks for reading!

http://www.auplod.com/u/uopald75307.png

Early Game Itemization:

Kat has 3 Items that she rushes 99% of the time. They are {{item:3285}} {{item:3157}} and {{item:3001}} .  Ill run through the situations for you.

{{item:3285}}: You rush this a lot. However its prime to get if you are ahead. If you see that you are pushing them into their tower and winning trades easily, Rush {{item:3285}}. If you see a lot of roaming opportunities, rush {{item:3285}}.

Rush {{item:3157}} If you are vs AD Laner. That's all you would normally get this for. Otherwise get it second.

Rush {{item:3001}} if you are struggling vs an AP Laner. It gives you some good AP and MR. Good vs people like Diana or annie.


After your first item or so, her build stays the same. If you don't get Zhonya's first, get it second for fights. In the end, your build should looking something like this, in purchase order:

**Runes:**

Katarina's runes are pretty standard. If you only Have 2 Rune pages I would suggest taking the basic AP Page.

x3 Ability Power Quints
x9 Magic Pen Marks
x9 Armor Seals
x9 Magic Resist Glyphs

If you have more (I Personally have 9) It is best to take at least 2 or 3 separate ones for her based on matchups.

A good page when against AD Laners such as Yasuo or Zed is:

x3 Ability Power Quints
x9 Magic Pen Marks
x9 Armor Seals
x9 Ability Power Glyphs

This page gives you a lot of AP and standard armor which makes for better trades. Also there is no need for the MR Glyphs against an AD champion. If they have a lot of ap in other parts of the map (e.g if they have liss top, nid jung, and sona sup) you  might want to pack some Scaling MR Glyphs, but its up to you.

When vs AP Midlaners such as Ahri or Leblanc, try to bring this page:

x3 AP Quints
x9 Magic Pen Marks
x9 Scaling Health Seals
x9 Magic Resist Glyphs 

With this you can get 200+ Health at level 18 and also stay sturdy in early trades.

**Masteries:**

With the new keystone masteries, Kat has a couple of options. Both DFT and Thunderlord's are viable. I like to take DFT if I know I am versing a counter and wont be helping my team much till mid/late game. Also the DoT it offers allows for more efficient poking. However, if you are confident in your ability to trade, Thunderlord's Decree is a nice option as it gives you even more burst. I just don't like to take this verse counters like Diana when I know I cant trade wither her, especially when Katarina is melee. Other then keystones, masteries like Assassin, Merciless, and Bounty Hunter are essential on her as it increases your damage output.

I hope this was helpful, feel free to ask anything else.

As one Kat main to another, how do you feel about the Zed matchup? I've struggled a bit more recently while facing him, although I know to immediately E away once his ult animation finishes. He wasn't too much of a problem up until ~50% armor penetration was the norm.

> although I know to immediately E away once his ult animation finishes. He wasn't too much of a problem up until ~50% armor penetration was the norm.

That's how I feel. Its getting to the point now where your last resort is just poking him. You have to out shine him in teamfights, I feel kat does a little better at deleting considering she has multi target burst. In lane though, you have to know when to roam because you cant really fight him alone.

> But sometimes i engage first. Just q e w and  and your team should kill someone so then u can 1shot them team cuz they should use their cc on your teammates and u can easily kill their entire team. But if u feed as f*ck u can just q e w thunder lord their adc or mid and just ward jump away.

This can be a good tactic if you have no engage, it can throw the enmy off guard and lead your team to victory but is quite risky. 1 stun could be the end of you, and then that leaves a 5v4 and your team is down a carry.

Kassadin is overall a rough lane. Whenever you face a rough laner, try taking teleport. This provides more pressure on the map and you can get fed off of bot lane ganks much easier. You will have to adapt to no ignite, but the payoff is worth it in my opinion. A good way to trade Kassadin early on is by baiting him to use his Q on you, then once the shield is gone, Q him. It's not much damage, but it will be of use to you whilst trying to poke.

You could also try some flat magic resist glyphs versus those two, although I don't prefer it.
